Notable works by Ngugi wa Thiong'o include:  Weep Not, Child (1964) The River Between (1965) A Grain of Wheat (1967) Petals of Blood (1977) Devil on the Cross (written during detention, first novel in Gikuyu language) Matigari (1986) Wizard of the Crow (2006) Dreams in a Time of War (memoir) In the House of the Interpreter (memoir) Birth of a Dream Weaver (memoir)

Specific novels by Abdulrazak Gurnah:  Memory of Departure  1987 Pilgrim's Way  1988 Dottie  1990 Paradise  1994 Admiring Silence  1996 By the Sea  2001 Desertion  2005 The Last Gift  2011 Gravel Heart  2017 Afterlives  2020

Notable literary works by Binyavanga Wainaina include:  One Day I Will Write About This Place (memoir, 2011)  How to Write About Africa (satirical essay, 2005)  Discovering Home (short story, 2002)   These works showcase Wainaina's sharp wit, incisive humor, and profound insight into African societies and Western narratives about Africa.

Notable works by Okot p'Bitek include:  Song of Lawino (1966) Song of Ocol (1970) Song of a Prisoner (1971) Song of Malaya (1971) White Teeth (novel) Scholarly works on African religions and oral literature  These works showcase p'Bitek's mastery of combining traditional Acholi oral tradition with contemporary themes, making his writing accessible to both educated and common audiences.

Notable works by Ngugi wa Thiong'o include:  The River Between A Grain of Wheat Petals of Blood Devil on the Cross (written on toilet paper during detention) Matigari Wizard of the Crow Dreams in a Time of War In the House of the Interpreter Birth of a Dream Weaver
